name: I Ain't Ever Gonna See The Sea (2013 LP)
description:
Latest Album!!
Released March 2013 at Adelaide Fringe Festival. 
See www.brillig.com.au for details

Featuring 13 tracks of cowboy ballads, gunfighter tales and sea shanties, the album was recorded at renowned SA studio Mixmasters with Mick Wordley (Archie Roach, Jeff Lang, Jordie Lane, Eric Bogle) at the helm. In a bold move, BRILLIG recorded and mixed in analogue to 2″ tape, a specialty of Mixmasters Studios.

The result is BRILLIG’s most engaging and hook-laden offering yet. Full of the warmth and clarity that defines the band’s ‘live’ sound, the album captures that bit of mystery and mischief that is the essence of BRILLIG.

Now with FREE SHIPPING

For DIGITAL versions of this LP, go to 
iTunes http://bit.ly/15ZIICt  
or
Cd Baby http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/brillig2

name: Most Unlucky of the Lucky Deer (2012 Rarities EP)
description:
Limited Edition EP of rarities, released at Brillig’s annual Xmas show. Debuted at #1 on Three D Radio (Dec 2012), and as of February 2013 has spent six weeks on the charts.

**LIMITED STOCK

Tracks:
1. Tennessee Owns My Soul (Roy Orbison)
2. The Hearse Song
3. It’s Been So Long Since Christmas
4. Most Unlucky of the Lucky Deer
5. Seizure of the Cyprus Brig at Recherche Bay, Aug 1829
6. The Hearse Song (Live at the Grace Emily)
7. The Old Captain (Live at the Grace Emily)

name: The Red Coats (2010 LP)
description:
** Australian pressing

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Recorded in Australia by famed Adelaide Producer Matt Hills, "The Red Coats" is Brillig's debut acoustic album.

It has been released throughout Europe, UK, Russia & North America by German label Black Rain, to coincide with Brillig's international festival debut and CD Launch Tour. It was launched in Brillig's hometown of Adelaide, Australia in March 2010 during the Adelaide Fringe Festival, and national tour dates will be announced shortly.

Continuing in the same acoustic style as the Jack Davey EP (2008), the new 12 track album also contains more up-tempo songs, sea shanties, a beautiful ghost story, a tribute to Brillig's favourite drink Absinthe, and of course the requisite folk murder ballads.



The CD has gathered rave reviews:

* "9.5 out of 10" - ORKUS Magazine (Germany)
* "a total work of art."- MEDIENKONVERTER (Germany)
* "a masterpiece ...musical pearls full of fragility & grace." - USELINKS (Germany)
* "Absolutely recommendable."- DARK MOMENTS (Germany)
* "The offspring between Nick Cave & The Pogues. " SIDE-LINE (Belgium)

Track Listing:

1. Death At Sea 
2. The Red Coats 
3. Bird from the Ashes
4. Assorted Fate 
5. The Old Captain
6. The Frozen Lake 
7. Intermission 
8. Absinthe Makes the Heart Grow Fonder
9. Jack Davey
10. Springtime in Kyoto
11. Phantom's Theme
12. Emily of the Grace 

FREE SHIPPING

This LP is also available to purchase in digital, lossless format from http://brillig.bandcamp.com , and you can preview all tunes at http://www.soundcloud.com/brillig

name: Semaphore Songs (compilation LP)
description:
Murder, ship wrecks, cougars, hot chips, carousels, ghosts, love, struggle, Semaphore Workers Club and Port Misery are some of the subjects that have inspired ten SA composers to write ballads, ditties and sea shanties for the Semaphore Songs compilation CD, launched in February 2012.

Artists include Brillig, Heather Frahn, Don Morrison, Emily Davis, Cal Williams Jr, Mick Kidd, Glenn Skuthorpe, Nancy Bates, The Baker Suite and Melody Feder.

You can preview Brillig's track "Port Misery", or purchase it singly as an digital file, on http://brillig.bandcamp.com
